* Collaborate with project managers, designers, technical writers/editors, and other stakeholders to review and refine submitted materials for inclusion in project documents.
* Suggest improvements to ensure clarity, accuracy, and consistency with company or client styles.

title: Cost Controller - UAE National
description:
**Company Description** **Are you ready to take your career to the next level? Your future starts here.**  

  

Join Egis, where your ambition meets unparalleled growth opportunities. As we continue to expand within Canada, we're looking for talented professionals like you to be a part of our innovative team. Imagine working alongside over 1,000 top\\-tier engineers, architects, and planners, all dedicated to shaping the future of infrastructure and development.  

  

At Egis, your skills and aspirations will find the perfect environment to thrive. Elevate your career with us and be a driving force in our exciting journey.


Our values showcase everything we believe in:

**A Responsible Company** \\- We care about people, and we care about our impact; acting responsibly wherever we work and whatever we do.

**A People\\-First Company** \\- This is an environment of mutual respect where every team member matters, no matter who they are.

**A Creative Company** \\- Creativity is in our DNA. This is the fuel that helps us tackle the major challenges of our time.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a detail\\-oriented and analytical Cost Controller to join our team in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. As a Cost Controller, you will be reporting to the Portfolio Performance Controller and play a crucial role in supporting the financial management and cost control processes of our projects. You will work collaboratively with project managers, finance teams, and other stakeholders to ensure projects are completed within approved budgets while maintaining financial health throughout the project lifecycle.

* Review and control project budgets in collaboration with project managers and your line manager, ensuring alignment with project objectives and financial constraints.
* Participate to regular variance analysis to compare actual costs against planned costs, investigating reasons for variances and implementing corrective measures.
* Support the review and analysis of earned value metrics to support project forecasting, variance analysis, and reporting to project stakeholders.
* Participate to the project cash flow, ensuring costs are aligned with project milestones and payments to vendors and subcontractors are made according to contract terms.
* Support the analysis of financial statements to identify potential improvements and develop strategies to optimize cost\\-effectiveness against approved budgets.
* Assist in the preparation of annual budgets.
* Collaborate with project managers to identify cost\\-saving opportunities and recommend measures to reduce expenses.
* Perform cost\\-benefit analysis on prospective projects and provide associated metrics to support the decision makers.
* Support the preparation of comprehensive financial reports to management to aid decision\\-making processes.

  

**Qualifications**  

* UAE National mandatory, only UAE nationals will be reviewed and considered
* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
* Fresh Graduate or Junior experience in cost control or financial management, preferably within the Construction / Maintenance industry
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving abilities with a detail\\-oriented approach
* Thorough understanding of accounting principles, budgeting procedures, and Earned Value Management (EVM) principles
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex financial information to various stakeholders
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite, particularly Excel for financial modelling and analysis
* Experience with financial forecasting, variance analysis, and project cash flow management
* Knowledge of industry\\-specific financial regulations (IFRS15\\) and reporting standards (preferred)

 **Additional Information**  

Immediate joiners preferred


the role is to ensure effective cost management and margin optimization across the division's infrastructure projects by acting as the key financial liaison between Project Managers and your Management. This role ensures the integrity of project cost data, timely cost tracking, proactive margin control, and compliance with financial standards. It also supports continuous improvement through advanced Excel and Power BI utilization.

title: Electrical Inspector
description:
RMJM is seeking to appoint Electrical inspector to support the continued growth of our Dubai Studio.


**Responsibilities will include, but may not be limited to:**


* Assist the Electrical Engineer in performing the contractual duties on site.
* Attending to Inspection Requests (IR’s) submitted by the contractor and take appropriate action in a timely manner.
* Review submitted shop drawings against contract drawings and specifications, local codes and statutory requirements and international best practice.
* Report any works carried out by contractor found to not be in accordance with approved drawing and specifications and report to stakeholders for appropriate action.
* Monitor quality of works and assess the safety at site including health and environmental issues, ensuring compliance with contractual /
* QCS specifications and safety and health risk assessments.
* Maintain records for daily activities on site including progress photos and ensure they are readily available for inspection as and when required.
* Prepare surveillance report(s) for deficiencies of work found at site and non conformance reports (NCR) if required in view of the development of events.
* Check and ensure effective co\\-ordination between discipline related works and all other disciplines.
* Provide technical input and experiences to resolve any discipline related issues on site that may arise.
* Carrying out Snagging/De snagging inspection and handing over the works to the required level of quality.
* Inspection/checking all testing and commissioning of MEP equipment’s/systems carried out at site to satisfy the project requirements.
* Ensure performance of the work in strict accordance with the plans and specifications.
* Receive material inspection requests (MIR) from contractor, inspect electrical \\& instrumentation materials delivered at site and report on quantity and technical compliance and sign off requests.
* Inspect the installation works of all electrical \\& instrumentation items/systems as per approved shop drawings.
* Ensure that safety critical aspects of the project are identified and actively addressed.
* Ensures that the project quality control procedures are used for the construction supervision works and monitors it for improvement.
* Ensure site progress information is communicated regularly.
* Assist the Electrical Engineer with the review of the O\\&M manuals and As Built drawings.
* Coordinate the works to ensure successful hand\\-over of the project


**Qualifications and Skills:**


* Diploma in Electrical Engineering (or equivalent).
* Minimum of 7 years of electrical construction work experience related on major projects preferably in the Gulf region.
* Good written and oral communication, and interpersonal skills, as well as a demonstrated ability to interact effectively with project team.
* Must be able to read and interpret blueprints and construction specifications and be thoroughly familiar with construction related processes related to area of assignment.
* Must be fully computer literate and able to utilize computer technology to access data, maintain records, generate reports, etc. and any project specific engineering and construction relevant software.


To apply, please send your CV and portfolio to **careers@rmjmd3\\.com**.



We thank all applicants for their interest. However, due to the high number of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Sales Manager - Drone Shows
description:
**About us:**  

Cyberdrone is an international creator of high\\-tech drone shows. We transform UAVs into powerful, high\\-speed, long\\-lasting light machines and craft stunning visual experiences with complex animation.  

Our diverse team of 50 professionals— including engineers, artists, and business experts—pushes the boundaries of drone technology and innovation to lead the industry. At Cyberdrone, we aim to amaze and inspire. We believe the show must not only go on—it must excel.  

To support our rapid growth, we are expanding our team with a sales Manager based in Dubai, responsible for managing sales and business development in the UAE and international markets, driving revenue growth and achieving strategic sales targets.

title: Rigger
description:
* **Services \\& Operations**
* **Permanent Contract**
* **Mid\\-Senior Level**
* **Dubai**

  
**About Us**

  

For over 50 years, Waagner Biro Bridge Services has been a prominent name among construction companies in Dubai and across the UAE, delivering cutting\\-edge construction engineering and services. Our expertise lies in offering innovative engineering solutions tailored to government and private sector needs.


Led by a skilled team of civil, mechanical, structural, and electrical engineers, we manage everything from design to build and maintenance. Our comprehensive approach ensures high\\-quality construction services in Dubai and the UAE.

 **About the Role**

  

* Carry out rigging, slinging, and lifting of heavy construction materials, tubular piles, sheet piles, precast blocks, and pontoons.
* Assist crane operators by giving proper hand signals and radio communication during lifting.
* Ensure correct load balancing, securing, and positioning before lifting and lowering.
* Inspect rigging equipment (slings, chains, hooks, shackles, spreader beams, ropes) before and after use.
* Maintain rigging tools in good condition and report defects or damages to the supervisor.
* Follow HSE regulations and safe lifting practices at all times.
* Ensure work area is clear before lifting or lowering loads.
* Wear mandatory PPE (helmet, safety shoes, life jacket, gloves, harness).
* Stop unsafe operations and report hazards immediately.
* Assist in handling and positioning tubular piles for driving and sheet piles for quay walls and breakwaters.
* Support construction crew in jetty, pontoon, quay wall, and floating structure installation.
* Secure loads for barge and pontoon transport.
* Work closely with site engineers, supervisors, and crane operators.
* Use standard rigging hand signals and communication methods.
* Follow instructions and work as part of a team in marine environments.
* Comply with site rules, permit\\-to\\-work systems, and method statements.
* Assist in loading/unloading of materials from trucks, barges, and pontoons.
* Carry out any additional duties assigned by the site supervisor or foreman.

 **What do we need from you**

  

* Minimum 3–5 years’ experience as a Rigger in marine or heavy civil construction in UAE.
* Must hold a valid Rigger Certificate (Level 1/2/3\\) approved by Dubai Municipality / DM / TUV / DNV / Third\\-party.
* Basic understanding of English (reading safety signs, instructions).
* Strong knowledge of rigging \\& slinging techniques.
* Teamwork and communication skills with crane operators and site crew.
* Ability to follow instructions and ensure safety\\-first approach.
* Adaptability to work in marine site conditions (on barges, pontoons, jetties, offshore platforms).
* Physical fitness and ability to work in offshore/marine environments.

 **What's in it for you?**

  

Civil Infra structure is added value is mandatory

title: BOD Engineer
description:
**What will you do**


The BoD Engineer is a key role. You will be based in Dubai and work closely with all the local Sales, Field and Product Controls team, helping them to achieve their business objectives, creating demand from the specification stage of relevant projects.


The main goal of this role is to identify and develop solutions, to define vertical markets, new opportunities, and develop strategic initiatives with highly visible, prestigious customers such as end users, consultants, contractors, A\\&E,... You will be responsible to develop long term relationships with customer to promote the demand of our Controls products in any market.


Part of your daily activity will be related to expanding brand awareness alongside the territory. Hence, you will prepare and deliver high\\-quality technical seminars/presentations, product demonstrations to consultants, developers, end user and recommend viable solutions for their project requirements. Therefore, a strong technical background is required.


As a member of this team, you will work within a vibrant environment that provides a platform for you to use your experience to deliver our business objectives.

**How will you do it**


As a BoD Engineer, you will use in\\-depth technical knowledge of Controls products and facilitate initiatives for the team, consultants, developer and end users on design and specification.


You will liaise with R\\&D, Training, Product Management and Technical Support resources to ensure that proposals and feature requests include technical solutions that accurately address customer needs, in line with Johnson Controls, Inc. product strategies.


You will develop necessary design, technical and marketing tools to support clients on existing and new products.


To improve forecast accuracy, you will maintain record of target opportunities, quotes, projects, contacts and correspondence in company approved databases.


You are a hunter driven to seek and develop strong customer relationships, self\\-motivated enjoying the challenge of working independently to drive your territory growth. You’re naturally perseverant, tenacious and consistent in your approach to work, managing multiple priorities simultaneously because of your excellent planning, organization and time management skills.

**What we look for**

**Required**

* Minimum 10 years of sales or business development experience in BMS products.
* Experience with systems design is mandatory. Technical knowledge of Controls
* Excellent presentation and persuasion skills, with well\\-developed communication skills, able to influence at all levels. Proven ability to secure product specifications from end users, consultants, and installers.
* Experience in strategic planning, marketing, and market research.
* High level prospecting skills. Capability to identify decision makers and stakeholders.
* Very proactive behavior. Work independently as a 100% individual contributor, collaborating cross\\-functionally with internal teams.
* A team\\-player mindset—success in this role requires cross\\-functional collaboration.
* Flexible in travelling across the country
* Unquestionable integrity and ethics.
* Provider of out\\-of\\-the\\-box solutions, with a can\\-do attitude is required and very result driven mentality.

title: CNS/ATM Associate
description:
* **Advisory Services**
* **Fixed\\-term Contract**
* **Associate**
* **Dubai**

  
**About Us**

  

Egis is an international player active in architecture, consulting, construction engineering and mobility services. We create and operate intelligent infrastructures and buildings that respond to the climate emergency and contribute to more balanced, sustainable and resilient territorial development. Operating in 100 countries, Egis puts the expertise of its 19,500 employees at the service of its clients and develops cutting\\-edge innovations accessible to all projects. Through its wide range of activities, Egis is a key player in the collective organisation of society and the living environment of citizens all over the world.  

  

With 3,500 employees across 8 countries in the Middle East, Egis has delivered over 700 complex development projects, stimulating economic growth and enhancing quality of life. Ranked among the top ten firms in the Middle East by Engineering News Record (ENR), Egis is committed to sustainable development. The Group’s operations in the Middle East are built on strategic acquisitions and a deep understanding of local market conditions. Egis’ long history of providing comprehensive engineering, consulting, and project management services makes it a trusted partner for regional governments, investors, and developers.  



  

**About the Role**

  

We are seeking a CNS/ATM Associate to join our team in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. As a key member of our organization, you will be responsible for supporting the delivery of complex Communication, Navigation, Surveillance/Air Traffic Management (CNS/ATM) projects, ensuring their successful implementation and alignment with organizational goals.

* Support CNS/ATM projects from initiation to completion, ensuring adherence to scope, schedule, and budget
* Coordinate with cross\\-functional teams, including engineers, technicians, and stakeholders
* Identify and mitigate project risks, implementing effective solutions
* Ensure compliance with aviation regulations and standards throughout project lifecycle
* Facilitate effective communication among project team members, stakeholders, and senior management
* Monitor project progress, prepare status reports, and present updates to leadership
* Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in CNS/ATM systems

 **What do we need from you**

  

* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Aviation, or related field
* Minimum 5 years of experience in CNS/ATM projects
* Strong knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2\\)
* Proven expertise in CNS/ATM systems and technologies
* Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills
* Proficiency in project management software (e.g., Microsoft Project, Primavera)
* Knowledge and understanding of aviation regulations and standards (ICAO, FAA, EASA)
* Experience in the aviation or aerospace industry
* Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills
* Ability to work effectively in a fast\\-paced, dynamic environment
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Experience in AutoCAD and GIS
* Experience in Fast Time Simulation Modelling Tools (Airtop, TAAM, Cast etc)

title: Kitchen & Laundry Technician
description:
**Additional Information**  

**Job Number**25165452  

**Job Category**Engineering \\& Facilities  

**Location**The Ritz\\-Carlton Dubai International Financial Centre, DIFC off Sheikh Zayed Road, Dubai, United Arab Emirates, United Arab Emirates  

**Schedule**Full Time  

**Located Remotely?**N  

**Position Type** Non\\-Management  

**POSITION SUMMARY**

  



Respond and attend to guest repair requests. Communicate with guests/customers to resolve maintenance issues with little to no supervision. Perform preventive maintenance on tools and equipment, including cleaning and lubrication. Visually inspect tools, equipment, or machines. Carry equipment (e.g., tools, radio). Identify, locate, and operate all shut\\-off valves for equipment. Maintain maintenance inventory and requisition parts and supplies as needed. Assure each day’s activities and problems that occur are communicated to the other shifts using approved communication programs and standards. Display advanced ability to read standard blue prints and electrical schematics concerning plumbing and HVAC. Display above average engineering operations skills and strong general mechanical ability. Display proficiency in at least three of the following categories, above average skills in three more of the following categories and basic skills in the remaining categories: air conditioning and refrigeration, electrical, mechanical, plumbing, pneumatic/electronic systems and controls, carpentry and finish skills, kitchen equipment, vehicles, energy conservation, and/or general building management. Display solid knowledge and skill in the safe use of hand and power tools and other materials required to perform repair and maintenance tasks. Safely perform highly complex repairs of the physical property, electrical, plumbing and mechanical equipment, air conditioners, refrigeration and pool heaters \\- ensuring all methods, materials and practices meet company standards and Local and National codes \\- with little or no supervision. Troubleshoot and perform repairs on all types of equipment (e.g., pump and motor replacement), plumbing (e.g., plunge toilets and unclog drains), electrical equipment including lamps, air conditioners, HVAC equipment, cosmetic items, extension cords, vacuum cleaners, internet devices, replace electrical switches and outlets, and program TV's. Use the Lockout/Tagout system before performing any maintenance work. Display advanced knowledge of all engineering computer programs related to preventative maintenance, energy management, and other systems, including devices that interact with such programs. Perform advanced troubleshooting of hotel Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) systems. Display the ability to train and mentor other engineers as necessary. Display ability to perform Engineer on Duty responsibilities, including readings and rounds.

  



Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report any maintenance problems, safety hazards, accidents, or injuries; complete safety training and certifications; and properly store flammable materials. Ensure uniform and personal appearances are clean and professional, maintain confidentiality of proprietary information, and protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards, anticipate and address guests’ service needs, assist individuals with disabilities, and thank guests with genuine appreciation. Adhere to quality expectations and standards. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others, support team to reach common goals, and listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Speak with others using clear and professional language. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 50 pounds without assistance and heavier lifting or movement tasks with assistance. Move up and down stairs, service ramps, and/or ladders. Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Enter and locate work\\-related information using computers. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested.

  



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent and vocational or technical background.


Related Work Experience: Extensive experience and training in general maintenance, electrical or refrigeration, parts inventory and requisition, exterior and interior surface preparation and painting.


At least 2 years of hotel engineering/maintenance experience.


Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.


License or Certification: Valid Driver’s License

  



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS


Universal Chlorofluorocarbon (CFC) Certification


Must meet applicable state and federal certification and/or licensing  

requirements.

title: Sales Director - Public Sector - UAE
description:
**What we’re all about.**


Do you ever have the urge to do things better than the last time? We do. And it’s this urge that drives us every day. Our environment of discovery and innovation means we’re able to create deep and valuable relationships with our clients to create real change for them and their industries. It’s what got us here – and it’s what will make our future. At Quantexa, you’ll experience autonomy and support in equal measures allowing you to form a career that matches your ambitions. 41% of our colleagues come from an ethnic or religious minority background. We speak over 20 languages across our 50\\+ nationalities, creating a sense of belonging for all.

**If our incredible culture sounds like you, we’d love you to join us.**

**The opportunity.**


Do you strive to make a difference in the Government? To support innovation and change which will drive business growth, trusted risk management and customer centricity across the industry for our clients and partners? At Quantexa, we do.


This urge and desire to challenge us and the industry is what drives us every day! At Quantexa our culture is underpinned by, not only our ability to build market leading AI\\-driven technology but, being able to create real change across the Government/Banking sector. It’s what got us here to supporting the Government on a number of key projects. But we won’t be stopping there **\\#UNSTOPPABLE.**


The Sales Director for public sector will join a collaborative team who are looking to build on current relationships but also build new ones too. This position and team is central to the growth of our META team. Working with Solution Engineering, Product, Marketing, Delivery and Customer success teams, you will be responsible for executing the sales go\\-to\\-market strategy, identifying new opportunities, building our pipeline, winning new deals and meeting company targets.

**What you’ll be doing.**


Typical responsibilities include working with META GM \\& The Director of Solution Engineering to define and execute the sales strategy and go\\-to\\-market plan for the Territory; consistently delivering against sales targets and contributing to the overall growth of the business. Your role will be a combination of hunting and farming, we have a great pipeline that needs nurturing, but we also require someone with the hunting mentality to go after new logos.


You will tasked with bringing together people from different teams. You will work with Solutions Engineers, Marketing, Delivery, Solution Success and many other areas.

**Additionally:**

* This role will require travel to client offices in Dubai and Gulf region as needed.

**Requirements**

**What you’ll bring.**

* + A good understanding of the Government Sector issues and ability to ‘advise and solutionize’ with the customer through a consultative sales\\-based approach.
* + Experience of selling into any of the following areas within the region is highly desirable: Borders, taxation, customs, law enforcement, Ministry of Economy and Ministry of Finance
* + A good understanding of enterprise sales in 2 or more of the following countries; UAE, Oman, Kuwait, Bahrain,
* + A track record of positioning and selling Enterprise software either directly or as part of an ecosystem.
* + Experience of building partnerships across System Integrators, Cloud platform providers and Consultancy organizations.
* + A good understanding of Public Sector operational and buying processes.
* + Experience nurturing accounts and identifying cross sell and upsell opportunities with existing clients.
* + Determination to succeed in challenging circumstances.
* + Ability to integrate into effective sales teams and lead opportunities.
* + Ability to be an independent decision\\-maker but equally is inclusive when evaluating options.
* + Ambitious and energetic with strong inter\\-personal skills.
* + Strong commercial and entrepreneurial qualities.
* + Good team player, capable of delivering results in less than perfect circumstances.
* + Ability to support market changes, flagging these early and reacting effectively and positively.
* + Ability to plan for the future.
* + Can perform effectively in complex and difficult environments.
* + Can achieve success through others.
* + Optimistic in outlook and can identify opportunities.
* + Constructive, resilient and perseverant.

**Benefits**

**Our perks and quirks.**


What makes you Q will help you to realize your full potential, flourish and enjoy what you do, while being recognized and rewarded with our broad range of benefits.


We offer:


Competitive salary* Company bonus

Free Calm App Subscription \\#1 app for meditation, relaxation and sleep ‍* ️

Annual leave, national holidays \\+ birthday off!* 
* Ongoing personal development
* Company wide socials

**Our mission.**


We have one mission. To help businesses grow. To make data easier. And to make the world a better place. We’re not a start\\-up. Not anymore. But we’ve not been around that long either. What we are is a collection of bright, passionate minds harnessing complexities and helping our clients and their communities. One culture, made of many. Heading in one direction – the future.

**It’s all about you.**


We want you to feel welcome, valued, and respected—because it’s your individuality and passion that make you *Q*. We see that, and we celebrate it. That’s why we’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.


We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment, continuously improving to ensure everyone belongs. Our recruitment process is designed to be inclusive and accessible. If you need any reasonable adjustments or accommodations, please let our Talent Acquisition Team know—we’re happy to assist.


No matter your race, beliefs, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, neurodiversity, or abilities—whoever you are—if you're a passionate, curious, and caring human eager to push the boundaries of what’s possible, we want to hear from you.

title: Networking Engineer
description:
At **Al Haktur IT Solutions**, we deliver advanced technology solutions that power businesses to perform efficiently and securely. We are looking for a skilled and detail\\-oriented **Networking Engineer** to join our expert IT team in **Dubai**. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining, securing, and optimizing our company’s network infrastructure to ensure uninterrupted connectivity and system performance.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Design, implement, and maintain network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless systems.
* Monitor network performance and troubleshoot connectivity issues promptly.
* Ensure network security through access controls, firewalls, and regular vulnerability assessments.
* Support internal users by resolving network\\-related technical problems efficiently.
* Manage network configurations, backups, and documentation.
* Collaborate with vendors and service providers to ensure reliable connectivity and service quality.
* Perform regular system updates, firmware installations, and preventive maintenance.
* Assist in planning and implementing network expansions or upgrades.
* Provide technical input for IT projects and system improvements.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Networking Engineer or in a similar IT infrastructure role.
* Strong understanding of LAN/WAN, VPNs, firewalls, and routing protocols.
* Hands\\-on experience with Cisco, Mikrotik, or Fortinet devices is preferred.
* Excellent troubleshooting and problem\\-solving skills.
* Knowledge of network security best practices and compliance standards.
* Relevant certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, or CompTIA Network\\+ are an advantage.


At **Al Haktur IT Solutions**, we value innovation, teamwork, and reliability. Joining our **Dubai** office as a **Networking Engineer** gives you the opportunity to work with cutting\\-edge technologies and contribute to delivering secure, high\\-performing IT solutions that empower businesses to succeed.

title: Senior Specialist - Project Controls
description:
**Company Description** **Work with Us. Change the World.**


At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.


There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.


We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

 **Job Description**  

AECOM are looking for a Senior Project Controls Specialist to join their team in Dubai who will be responsible for executing comprehensive project control activities across medium to large\\-scale projects or within a broader project management team. This role includes managing project control systems, analysing performance data, overseeing scope and change management, and contributing to strategic project reporting. The Senior Specialist also undertakes function\\-wide tasks and supports continuous improvement initiatives, while mentoring junior team members.

**Role \\& Responsibilities**

* Monitors project financial performance through application of advanced project control methodologies.
* Works closely with the Project Management team and interfaces with various disciplines.
* Develops the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and baseline budgets, in coordination with the Project Manager.
* Collects progress data and performs Earned Value Analysis.
* Collects actual costs and analyzes performance against baseline budgets.
* Investigates variances from the baseline and analyzes performance trends.
* Pro\\-actively identifies and communicates financial risks and opportunities.
* Develops and communicates weekly performance tracking reports.
* Establishes and analyzes project cost projections based on deployments and cost trends.
* Provides project performance data for project audit reviews purposes and participates in Management reviews.
* Maintains records of the project financial files in line with the company’s established protocols.
* Drives compliance to AECOM governance requirements.
* Safeguards AECOM’s Change Management process.
* Works with company financial systems and processes.


Requirements:

* Solid knowledge and hands on experience on Earned Value Management methodology and its application on complex design projects.
* Solid understanding of cost/schedule integration concepts and progress measurement fundamentals.
* Strong analytical skills and structured thinking.
* Ability to present and communicate effectively financial data for different audiences.
* Solid understanding of accounting principles and recognizes the financial impact of various project actions and contractual obligations.
* Proficient with tools and techniques to analyze and present substantial amount of data.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Typically, a minimum of 8\\+ years of experience.
* Bachelor or Master of Science or Engineering or relevant Degree from an accredited University.
* Working towards a professional membership.

  

**Additional Information** **About AECOM**


AECOM is proud to offer comprehensive benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD\\&D, disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absences, voluntary benefits, perks, flexible work options, well\\-being resources, employee assistance program, business travel insurance, service recognition awards, retirement savings plan, and employee stock purchase plan.


AECOM is the global infrastructure leader, committed to delivering a better world. As a trusted professional services firm powered by deep technical abilities, we solve our clients’ complex challenges in water, environment, energy, transportation and buildings. Our teams partner with public\\- and private\\-sector clients to create innovative, sustainable and resilient solutions throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm that had revenue of $16\\.1 billion in fiscal year 2024\\. Learn more at aecom.com.

**What makes AECOM a great place to work**


You will be part of a global team that champions your growth and career ambitions. Work on groundbreaking projects \\- both in your local community and on a global scale \\- that are transforming our industry and shaping the future. With cutting\\-edge technology and a network of experts, you’ll have the resources to make a real impact. Our award\\-winning training and development programs are designed to expand your technical expertise and leadership skills, helping you build the career you’ve always envisioned. Here, you’ll find a welcoming workplace built on respect, collaboration and community \\- where you have the freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.


As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in your potential and are here to help you achieve it. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Senior Project Manager - Waste Management
description:
Overview:

KEO is a creative enterprise, where innovation is a way of life. We are uniquely resourced with end\\-to\\-end services to take clients from inspiration – through conceptualization – to realization of planning, design or project delivery in the built and natural environments. For over 60 years we’ve led with vision, contributing to many of the world’s most ambitious projects, iconic places, remarkable experiences and prosperous communities.  

As a highly integrated and agile AEP/PMCM firm, KEO is recognized by ENR as one of the Top 225 International Design Firms and one of the Top 20 International PM/CM Firms. We are also ranked by World Architecture as the 51st largest global architecture firm and the \\#1 Firm in the Middle East Region in their 2024 WA100 Survey.  

We invite you to join us. Why?  

When you join KEO, you’ll discover more than just a job – you’ll find a supportive environment that fosters your professional development through internal global mobility and career development and does so within a culture that supports company\\-wide health and well\\-being through on\\-demand counselling services and regular workplace clinics. You will be invited to celebrate community events such as sports days, fun\\-runs, in\\-house sports teams and beach clean ups. In addition to your competitive package and benefits you will have access to a suite of policies that include hybrid working arrangements, individual athletic sponsorship, study assistance sponsorship, employee referral rewards.  


Responsibilities:

Our newest opportunity is for a **Project Manager or Senior Project Manager \\- Regional Waste Infrastructure Lead** to join our award\\-winning team in the **Dubai or Abu Dhabi, UAE.**  

This newly created role reflects KEO’s ambition to strengthen our capability supporting clients in delivering **waste infrastructure projects**.  

It is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced professional eager to contribute to one of the most dynamic and fast\\-growing markets, while representing **KEO as a regional leader** in the UK and Europe \\- building on our reputation and experience across the Middle East.  

As Regional Waste Infrastructure Lead, you will guide clients through the full infrastructure development lifecycle, from **early\\-stage feasibility and concept design** to **construction supervision and final handover**. You’ll work across a wide range of projects involving **thermal, mechanical, biological, and chemical treatment processes**.  

The successful candidate will report directly to the **Director of Waste Management** and play a key role in shaping and growing KEO’s capability in this critical sector.  

We envisage success in this role to include:* **Regional Client Leadership:** Develop and maintain trusted partnerships with clients. You’ll spend considerable time in client offices and on project sites to ensure our services reflect local needs and expectations.
* **Project Leadership:** Lead regional and international projects as Project Manager or Project Director, ensuring alignment with local regulations, environmental policies, and stakeholder priorities.
* **Specialist Technical Input:** Provide expert advice on treatment technologies and processes suited to local conditions and market drivers, supported by our global technical network.
* **Advisory Services:** Act as a trusted Technical Advisor to public and private sector clients on the delivery of waste infrastructure.
* **Feasibility \\& Design:** Lead feasibility, due diligence and options appraisals, develop basis\\-of\\-design documentation, and support procurement and investment decision\\-making.
* **Design Assurance:** Ensure compliance with best practice, health and safety standards, regulations, and user requirements \\- within defined cost and time limits.
* **Technical Oversight:** Prepare, review, and approve technical specifications; evaluate tender documents; and provide technical input across all project phases, from design and construction to commissioning and handover.
* **Collaboration \\& Mentorship:** Coordinate across disciplines, review subcontractor work, and guide junior engineers in their professional development.


Qualifications:

To be successful in this dynamic opportunity, we envision that your career journey to date will include:* **Minimum 10 years of relevant experience**, including proven success acting as Lead Technical Advisor through to financial close and as Owner’s Engineer during the construction phase.
* A **Charted Engineer** with a Degree in Mechanical, Chemical or Process Engineering.
* Deep understanding of **waste infrastructure investments**, including opportunities and risks across recycling, recovery, and thermal treatment facilities.
* Experience **mentoring and developing junior engineers**.
* **Fluency in Arabic** is advantageous.
* Experience with waste infrastructure projects in the Middle East.
* Desire to **represent KEO** as a regional lead, building our presence and reputation across the Middle East.
* Prepared to **undertake travel** across the Middle East and internationally, including assignments based in client offices or on\\-site as project needs dictate.


KEO’s performance is founded upon integrity, results, innovation, safety and our people. We embrace diversity and recognise its’ contribution to client success wherever we work.  

We are excited to hear how you can partner with our award\\-winning team and treat all expressions of interest confidentially.

title: Production Engineer Metal Finishing Deco MEA
description:
**About Crown**  



Crown Holdings, Inc., is a world leader in the metal packaging production process. We design and manufacture a wide range of innovative and sustainable metal packaging solutions and products. Our clients are some of the largest and most respected companies in the world.  



It's an exciting time to join our business because Crown offers you the opportunity to grow and develop your skills in an expanding industry.  



Crown was founded with the goal of valuing and promoting sustainability and this vision continues to be essential to our long\\-term future.  



**About this opportunity**
--------------------------



We are now looking to recruit a **Production Engineer Deco for MEA**, within our Project Engineering team, based at Dubai (UAE). The role reports to the Metal Finishing Team Leader EMEA, with a functional link to the Regional Manufacturing Director MEA.

  

The scope of the role is to support primarily 5 manufacturing locations in the Middle East and North Africa (UAE, Jordan, Saudi Arabia and Tunisia). You will also be involved in project work at new greenfield sites and newly acquired manufacturing locations.

  

**Your mission in Crown**  

Join us and participate in all the activities of the Metal decorating within the Project Engineering Team to improve all standards of the manufacturing processes in terms of quality, cost and efficiency.



The primary areas of activity and responsibility will include the Rutherford and Concorde decorators, pin\\-ovens, base protection systems and materials applied in the print process. You will be fully participating in all other areas of the Metal Finishing department, including Can Washing/Water Treatment and Metal protection.



You promote the development of SOP’s, Best Practices and Cost Reduction Programmes. You deliver classroom and hands\\-on training of Metal Finishing equipment and processes. You provide project support in all associated documentation, procurement and commissioning related to coater and decorator area equipment. You also provide operational support in all areas of Coaters, decorators and changeover and cost reduction activities.  

You are liaising with CROWN Technology on equipment, tooling, materials and process improvements and standardisation of specifications.

  


**About you**  

The successful candidate has a sound engineering background/ or you are qualified to ONC, HNC, HND or degree level. You are highly experienced in 2pc engineering and process knowledge, with a safety mind\\-set. You have the ability to acquire and utilise knowledge in the specific areas of coating and decorating equipment, base protection systems, pin\\-ovens and associated materials.



You are able to show proven ability to communicate clearly and concisely at all levels and you demonstrate with a logical approach, high levels of problem\\-solving and effective decision\\-making skills.



A self\\-starter, you are an effective team player, with strong leadership and interpersonal skills. You are as well computer literate. You are flexible to travel at short notice and for extended periods overseas, with the willingness to adapt to different cultures and circumstances. Fluency in English, another European language a plus.

**What Crown Offers You**


* The opportunity to build a career in a multi\\-cultural environment
* To be rewarded fairly and promoted based on merit and performance
* Professional and personal development through training and work experiences

Strong engagement and commitment to the safety of our employees  
* 

**Join us and become part of an international team of professionals who are passionate about sustainable packaging!**

  


**Working Together**  

  

Accessibility, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion are key features of Crown’s culture of Working Together. We aim to value and respect each individual and foster an environment where everyone is represented.


We strive to promote psychological safety, allowing colleagues to bring their authentic selves to work and ultimately generate a sense of belonging at Crown.

Learn more about Crown on our social media channels.

title: Principal Engineer Electrical - Dry Utilities
description:
**Company Description** **Work with Us. Change the World.**


At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.


There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of over 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.


We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

* undefined

* Design of electrical systems and dry utilities using Auto CAD Civil3D experience and skills including ProjectWise, Infraworks, Navisworks, BIM etc

**Qualifications**

* RTA project experience preffered.
* Proven experience leading engineering teams and managing complex projects
* Extensive knowledge of electrical engineering principles and practices, particularly in dry utility systems
* Proficiency in AutoCAD or similar CAD software and electrical design software
* Strong understanding of building codes, regulations, and safety standards relevant to dry utilities
* Expertise in urban infrastructure planning and sustainable energy solutions
* Excellent project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders
* Willingness to adapt to the unique challenges and opportunities presented by the Dubai market

  

**Additional Information** **About AECOM**


AECOM is proud to offer comprehensive benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD\\&D, disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absences, voluntary benefits, perks, flexible work options, well\\-being resources, employee assistance program, business travel insurance, service recognition awards, retirement savings plan, and employee stock purchase plan.

* Provide technical leadership and oversight for geometric design, horizontal and vertical alignments, cross\\-sections, and associated highway elements in accordance with UAE and international standards (AASHTO, DM, RTA, AASHTO Green Book).
* Review, coordinate, and integrate designs with other disciplines (structures, drainage, utilities, traffic, and environmental teams).
* Act as the technical authority for complex engineering challenges, ensuring designs meet safety, sustainability, and constructability requirements.
* Prepare and review technical reports, feasibility studies, design documents, specifications, and tender documents.
* Engage with clients (such as RTA, ADM, and other regional authorities), attend project meetings, and provide expert technical input.
* Contribute to project planning, resource allocation, and quality assurance to deliver projects on time and within budget.
* Mentor and develop junior engineers and provide knowledge sharing across the Transportation team.
* Support business development efforts including proposal preparation, presentations, and client relationship management.

 **Qualifications*** Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering or related discipline (Master’s preferred).
* 15\\+ years of relevant experience in highway engineering and design, preferably with exposure to major UAE or GCC infrastructure projects.
* Chartered / Professional Engineer status (CEng, PE, or equivalent) is strongly preferred.
* Proven track record in leading multidisciplinary teams in the delivery of highway and road infrastructure projects.
* Comprehensive knowledge of regional authority standards (RTA, DM, ADM) and international highway design codes (AASHTO, DMRB, etc.).
* Strong understanding of road safety engineering, sustainable transport solutions, and digital delivery tools (OpenRoads, Civil 3D, Infraworks, etc.).
* Excellent technical report writing, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
* Proactive, collaborative, and able to work in a fast\\-paced consultancy environment.

 **Additional Information** **About AECOM**


AECOM is proud to offer comprehensive benefits to meet the diverse needs of our employees. Depending on your employment status, AECOM benefits may include medical, dental, vision, life, AD\\&D, disability benefits, paid time off, leaves of absences, voluntary benefits, perks, flexible work options, well\\-being resources, employee assistance program, business travel insurance, service recognition awards, retirement savings plan, and employee stock purchase plan.


AECOM is the global infrastructure leader, committed to delivering a better world. As a trusted professional services firm powered by deep technical abilities, we solve our clients’ complex challenges in water, environment, energy, transportation and buildings. Our teams partner with public\\- and private\\-sector clients to create innovative, sustainable and resilient solutions throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm that had revenue of $16\\.1 billion in fiscal year 2024\\. Learn more at aecom.com.

**What makes AECOM a great place to work**


You will be part of a global team that champions your growth and career ambitions. Work on groundbreaking projects \\- both in your local community and on a global scale \\- that are transforming our industry and shaping the future. With cutting\\-edge technology and a network of experts, you’ll have the resources to make a real impact. Our award\\-winning training and development programs are designed to expand your technical expertise and leadership skills, helping you build the career you’ve always envisioned. Here, you’ll find a welcoming workplace built on respect, collaboration and community \\- where you have the freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.


As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in your potential and are here to help you achieve it. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Workshop Maintenance Engineer I
description:
##### **Job Purpose**

  

  

As a Workshops Maintenance Engineer I you will carry out routine maintenance tasks and defect rectification of aircraft components as per company and associated regulatory procedures.


**In this role you will:**

**Generic:**

* Carry out aircraft components maintenance and servicing tasks in compliance with manufacturer and safety procedures. Ensure that assigned aircraft components are maintained as per latest revisions of approved authority Technical Publications such as CMM, Aircraft documentation, Technical Notices, Quality Notices, and Engineering Procedures Manual etc. Ensure that personal approvals/licences are valid and applicable to aircraft components type/scope
* Determine if tooling/equipment used is serviceable and appropriate for the task and use specialised tooling where required. Ensure that trouble shooting procedures/tools used for fault rectification are carried out in a cost effective and efficient manner.
* Ensure that all activities performed are carried out in accordance with all safety rules and regulations and in adherence to company procedures, highlighting a deficiencies/requirement through the effective use of reporting tools. Ensure all work locations are kept clean and excellent housekeeping conditions are maintained.
* Maintain effective communication with Colleagues including Managers and Senior Engineers to ensure a seamless flow of information and to highlight any potential operational issues.
* Manage the performance of staff using performance review process and system. Ensure SMART goal setting, interim/annual reviews and development plans are in place for assigned staff members in accordance with company procedures.
* Attend training/recurrent modules as required to enhance skills and comply with CAR 145 requirements.
* Ensure resources and manpower available is support of the business needs allowing targets/milestones to be adequately achieved. Ensure that available resources are utilized fully to meet the business needs. Ensure for all staff allocated to him/her and themselves to efficiently clock on/clock off job cards in the process of performing their usual duties. Must be available to assume duties and responsibilities of shift manager/senior engineer shift whenever delegated by the section manager.

**Specific Functions for Airframe Components:**

* Proactively identify New Capabilities build\\-up opportunities of aircraft components and conduct feasibility study, justify the requirement of establishing New Capabilities via Research and Development (R\\&D), Cost Benefit Analysis (Business Cases) to enhance the workshop’s capabilities. Be conversant with 145 AMO regulatory framework. Liaise with company internal Compliance Monitoring teams for obtaining necessary Regulatory approvals for shop activities.
* Lead the project to build up the agreed new aircraft components capabilities until it is approved by regulatory. Liaise with Fleet Technical Management (Engineering Technical Services \\- ETS), Part 21 DOA, UAE GCAA MOA (Manufacturing Organization), Component Repair or Reliability Departments for gathering facts and solid justification data for the capability establishment. Define new Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) or Process Instruction Manuals / Stage Sheets / Work Order Job Cards that allows shop engineers to practice new capability deliverables. Develop and deliver training programs to enhance the technical proficiency of the Work Shop's staff. Introduce external training / refresher training to allow Authorization approval scopes of certifying engineers remain valid. Liaise with Technical Publications, ETS and ensure all Workshop publications (CMM, CMM\\-TR, SILs, CMM\\-ICA documents) are available for Workshop Personnel access.
* Coordinate with internal related stake holders to implement the built/approved new capabilities in the workshop until the output of production is fully compliance with regulations. Participate in company internal compliance monitoring 145 Audits, external EASA 145 or GCAA CAR 145 Audits and demonstrate workshop regulatory compliance at all times.
* To be involve into any potential optimization and/or continually improvement if it’s applicable for the newly built\\-up capabilities

**Specific Functions for Landing gear shop:**

* Responsible to perform, assist, and support all Overhaul/Repair/Inspection tasks required for landing gears (wide body is preferred) as well as any activity related to chapter 32 of CMM with in Shop.
* Responsible for corrective actions, root cause analysis and risk \\& opportunity analysis of any findings.
* Should have knowledge of NDT methods used in landing gear overhaul
* Should have knowledge of plating and machining methods used in a landing gear shop.

##### **Qualification**

**To be considered for the role, you must meet the following requirements:**

* Degree in Aeronautical subjects/Mechanical/Avionics/Electronic/Tech Engineering OR Aircraft Maintenance Engineering Licence OR Engineering Apprenticeship.
* 12 years of experience in Engineering Workshop.
* Landing gear workshop: 7\\+years of EASA Form1/GCAA AW1 certification experience.
Experience in Aircraft Maintenance Engineering related fields.  
* 

  

  

##### **Salary \\& benefits**

Join us in a management role and enjoy an attractive tax\\-free salary. On top of our generous travel benefits, including discounted flights and hotel stays around the world, this managerial role also has an excellent leave and healthcare package. That’s on top of transport benefits, life insurance and more. Find out what it’s like to live and work in our fast\\-paced, cosmopolitan home city in the Dubai Lifestyle section of our website www.emirates.com/careers .

title: Creative Technologist, Experiential Technology
description:
Long Description: **WHO WE ARE**

  


 AVI\\-SPL is a digital enablement solutions provider who transforms how people and technology connect to elevate experiences, create new value, and enable organizations to thrive and grow. We are the largest provider of collaboration technology solutions, which include our award\\-winning managed services.

  



Our highly certified industry experts and innovation leaders share a vision to help people work smarter and live better. We believe that success starts with a sound team and that an inclusive and diverse workplace moves us all forward.

 **WHAT YOU’LL DO**

  

As part of XTG (Experience Technology Group), Technologists provide creative AV designs to enable experiential storytelling. This customer\\-facing, senior design role supports business development, leads pre\\-sales creative engineering and provides on\\-going post\\-sales project support. The Technologist should be skilled in technology consulting for both internal sales and customers, providing leadership in planning and budgeting. Responsibilities include creating system descriptions, block flow diagrams, estimating hours, highlighting logistical challenges for pricing, and preparing equipment lists for customer proposals.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Provide creative technology and design leadership for XTG and their partners supporting the Dubai office.
* Partner with XTG Business Development Team to build relationships within the experiential design community internationally
* Work with the XTG Director of Strategic Partnerships to track new contacts and nurture existing partner relationships
* Translate customer requirements into creative visioning presentations and functional system designs
* Communicate design intent with hand sketches, electronic drawings, renderings, diagrams, outlines, storyboards, and/or narratives
* Contribute to the development of engineering and architectural (RCP/Floor Plan) drawings, calculations and facilitate coordination with disciplines and trades
* Review pre\\-construction design and documentation
* Assist with technical design pricing and identify any logistical challenges
* Generate functional system descriptions and block diagrams
* Provide engineering support to project installation team when needed
* Serve as Customer liaison for engineering inquiries
* Meet with vendors/prospective vendors to help evaluate products and identify new creative technologies
* Post sales project consultation
* Review and validate the work of Design Engineers
* Travel to various job sites is required
* Support of meetings outside of local time zones is required (up to 20 times per year)
* Other duties assigned as needed

 **WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR**

  

 **Must Haves:*** Excellent customer\\-facing and communications skills
* Communicate and interact with internal employees, clients and colleagues in a professional and timely manner
* Track record of designing and implementing experiential AV solutions
* Ability to work and think creatively as well as independently and ensuring to meet deadlines and solving problems with a 'how can it be done' attitude
* Ability to diagnose complex system problems
* Support user acceptance testing
* Advanced computer skills as required for the design configuration and operation of AV equipment
* Ability to travel nationally and internationally is required
* Previous work with consultancy, creative agency, production house or creative fabricator
* At least 10 years of AV experience
* Valid Driver's License and a Motor Vehicle Record that meets AVI\\-SPL driving standards
* Minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent
* Able to attend daily meetings and participate in project activities scheduled in Gulf Standard Time (GST) and attend weekly office meetings in Dubai.

**Nice\\-to\\-Haves:*** Formal education in Electronics or related field preferred
* AVIXA CTS\\-D
* A four\\-year degree or military experience may be considered in place of job experience. Formal education in Electronics or a related field is preferred.
* Experienced with Google Sketchup Pro or comparable design software
* Located in the Northeastern United States to support New York area projects

 **WHY YOU’LL LIKE WORKING HERE**

  

* Medical benefits, including vision and dental
* Paid holidays, sick days, and personal days
* Enjoyable and dynamic company culture
* Training and professional development opportunities

 **MORE ABOUT US**

  

AVI\\-SPL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law. AVI\\-SPL is an AA/Disabled/Veteran Protected Employer VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

  

AVI\\-SPL reserves the right to alter work hours and work location as necessary. Work hours may vary based on client requirements and may include travel to various locations in support of the account.

title: Project Controls Manager
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!


When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.


**Job Description:**

**Project Controls Manager**

**Dubai, UAE**

Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented **Project Controls** **Manager** to join our team!


**What You'll Be Doing:**

* Provide strategic leadership and oversight for project controls functions including planning, scheduling, cost management, progress tracking, risk mitigation, change control, and performance reporting across infrastructure programs.
* Provide guidance, direction, and specialized assistance to planning \\& risk staff, interface with clients, and attend regular meetings.
* Develop, implement, and maintain project controls processes, procedures, systems, plans and tools and monitor compliance.
* Arrange project controls workshops/meetings to discuss and assist contractors/consultants to close their project control issues.
* Develop a Master Schedule integrating multiple packages considering their interdependencies to identify and reflect the impact of one schedule/project on others.
* Review and convey PMC’s and Engineer’s consent to the Contractors’ Baseline schedule of works in line with Contract conditions, and using Parsons Recommended Practices.
* Validation of compatibility of project resources for timely completion of the project.
* Strong foreseeability to identify the potential risks/conflicts, and document them in the Project Risk Register.
* Evaluate \\& verify the planning and scheduling information from the updated / progress schedules. Identify the potential areas of delay/slippage, highlight the critical events \\& suggest mitigation measures / corrective actions / robust recovery plan.
* Exercise “What if” analysis to assess the time impact of each change, variation, and potential event at an early stage and provide alternative courses of action \\& advice before issuing instructions to contractors.
* Prepare regular progress reports / monthly reports with program analysis and recommendations, addressing program issues to ensure timely project completion, and preparing presentations regarding the work's progress concerning interim and major milestones.
* Evaluate claims including Extension of Time (EoT) and Disruption claims using recognized delay analysis techniques such as Time Impact Analysis and Window Analysis, with the ability to assess concurrent delays.
* Discuss, coordinate, and resolve the planning and scheduling problems with the PMC, the Contractor and the Employer.
* Coordination with the Client to finalize the contractor’s programs, reports, and claims.
* Actively participate in project meetings (e.g., kickoff, technical, coordination, progress reviews) and prepare concise, actionable minutes of meeting (MoM).
* Preparation of Trackers / Logs to monitor critical issues during the Design and Construction stages of the Project.
* Agree on the progress measurement system (PMS) and key indicators with the consultants/contractors during the project for monitoring purposes.
* Ability to communicate clearly conduct presentations to management and interface effectively with a diverse group of professionals. Provide reasoned \\& analytic response to the contractor notices and detailed particulars using programming data, sound construction practices, and contractual provisions.
* Maintain organized contemporary records to support claims analysis and contract administration processes.
* Issue formal delay notices and performance alerts when contractor progress is deficient or non\\-compliant with schedule obligations
* Be able to manage a team of one or more planning engineers, providing them with technical and leadership skills.
* Lead structured risk workshops with both client and contractor teams to identify and manage project risks and opportunities.
* Champion the adoption of automation and digitalization within the project controls function to improve reporting accuracy and reduce manual workloads.

**What Required Skills You'll Bring:**

* Bachelor's degree in civil engineering or construction management from a recognized institution.
* Minimum 15\\+ years of experience in Infrastructure projects, with min. 3 years’ experience in the UAE.
* Proficiency in Primavera P6, Primavera Risk Analysis, and Power BI.

  

**What Desired Skills You'll Bring:**

* Good written and oral communication skills
* Thorough knowledge of industry best practices and regulations.

Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels no matter the race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability or genetic information.
We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!


Parsons is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices. To learn more about recruitment fraud and how to report it, please refer to https://www.parsons.com/fraudulent\\-recruitment/ .

title: Junior Developer .Net
description:
Junior Developer .Net
TÜV SÜD – A global leader in the field of testing, inspection, management system certification and product certification renowned for quality, integrity and technical excellence.


Established more than 150 years ago in Germany, TÜV SÜD is a leading global provider of technical services with more than 28,000 highly skilled employees across 1,000 offices worldwide. TÜV SÜD offers a wide range of testing \\& product certification, inspection, auditing \\& system certification, training and knowledge services. We are a premium quality, safety, and sustainability solutions provider.


**Position Overview**  

We are looking for a motivated and detail\\-oriented Junior .NET Developer to join our development team.


The ideal candidate will assist in designing, coding, testing, and maintaining applications built using Microsoft technologies. This role offers an excellent opportunity to learn and grow under the guidance of experienced developers.


**Your Tasks**

* Develop, test, and maintain web and desktop applications using .NET Core / .NET Framework (C\\#).
* Assist in the design and implementation of new software features and modules.
* Support and troubleshoot existing applications to resolve bugs and performance issues.
* Collaborate with senior developers, QA engineers, and business analysts to deliver high\\-quality solutions.
* Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code following coding standards and best practices.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to team knowledge sharing.
* Work with Entity Framework, LINQ, and SQL Server for data access and management.
* Integrate third\\-party APIs and services when required.
* Maintain technical documentation for all development work.
**Your Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* 0–2 years of experience in software development using C\\# and .NET technologies.

**Your Skills**

* Basic understanding of ASP.NET MVC / .NET Core, Web APIs, and Razor Pages.
* Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and front\\-end frameworks (e.g., jQuery, React, or Angular).
* Good understanding of OOP principles, REST APIs, and database design.
* Experience with Microsoft SQL Server (queries, stored procedures, views).
* Knowledge of version control systems such as Git or Azure DevOps.
* Strong problem\\-solving and analytical skills.
* Eagerness to learn new technologies and adapt to changing environments.
* Good communication and teamwork abilities.

**Preferred (Nice to Have)**

* Experience with Entity Framework Core, Dependency Injection, and Unit Testing.
* Familiarity with Azure or other cloud platforms.
* Exposure to Agile / Scrum methodologies.
Basic knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.  
* 
We test, we audit, we inspect, we advise. We never stop challenging ourselves for the safety of society and its people. We breathe technology, we strive for professional excellence, and we leave a mark. We take the future into our hands. We are TÜV SÜD.

title: Document Controller - Site
description:
**Company Description**  

Egis is an international player active in architecture, consulting, construction engineering and mobility services. We create and operate intelligent infrastructures and buildings that respond to the climate emergency and contribute to more balanced, sustainable and resilient territorial development. Operating in 100 countries, Egis puts the expertise of its 19,500 employees at the service of its clients and develops cutting\\-edge innovations accessible to all projects. Through its wide range of activities, Egis is a key player in the collective organisation of society and the living environment of citizens all over the world.


With 3,500 employees across 8 countries in the Middle East, Egis has delivered over 700 complex development projects, stimulating economic growth and enhancing quality of life. Ranked among the top ten firms in the Middle East by Engineering News Record (ENR), Egis is committed to sustainable development. The Group’s operations in the Middle East are built on strategic acquisitions and a deep understanding of local market conditions. Egis’ long history of providing comprehensive engineering, consulting, and project management services makes it a trusted partner for regional governments, investors, and developers.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a highly organised and detail\\-oriented Document Controller to join our team at our construction site in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. As a key member of our site operations, you will be responsible for managing and maintaining all project\\-related documentation, ensuring compliance with company standards and local regulatory requirements.

* Establish and maintain an efficient document control system for all site\\-related materials, including drawings, correspondence, submittals, and reports
* Manage document flow between on\\-site teams, consultants, contractors, and local regulatory authorities
* Ensure timely distribution and tracking of all incoming and outgoing project documents
* Maintain up\\-to\\-date records of all document versions and approvals in both electronic and hard copy formats
* Review and verify document formats and metadata before submission to ensure compliance with client and authority requirements
* Generate document control reports for project reviews and audits
* Support site engineers and managers by retrieving, organising, and submitting necessary documentation
* Ensure confidentiality and security of sensitive project data
* Coordinate with IT and project teams to maintain document management systems
* Conduct regular audits to ensure documentation processes are followed effectively
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional teams to streamline document control processes and improve efficiency
* Adhere to site\\-specific safety protocols and procedures

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor's degree in Administration or a related field
* Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Document Controller on construction projects in the UAE, with at least 3 years in a site\\-based role
* Strong knowledge of document control systems and best practices, particularly in construction site environments
* Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook), Adobe Acrobat, and document management platforms such as Aconex. Aconex experience is a must
* Familiarity with documentation protocols and submission procedures specific to construction sites
* Excellent organisational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks in a fast\\-paced environment
* Strong attention to detail with the ability to handle large volumes of documentation accurately
* Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, to interact with various stakeholders on\\-site
* Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines in a dynamic construction site setting
* In\\-depth knowledge of construction industry documentation standards and site\\-specific requirements
* Fluency in English (written and spoken)
* Knowledge of local regulatory requirements in Dubai and the UAE
* Experience with site\\-specific document control processes and workflows
* Familiarity with construction site safety protocols and willingness to adhere to all safety guidelines
* Ability to work in a fast\\-paced, on\\-site environment, potentially in challenging weather conditions
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in a team environment

  

**Additional Information**  

The role will involve supporting multiple projects with Site visits across UAE.
